solution: 1. Ensure you are on a stable internet connection. 2. Restart the GlobalProtect service in Task Manager. 3. Check if your MFA (Multi-Factor Authentication) token has expired. 4. Flush DNS using 'ipconfig /flushdns' in terminal.

1. Go to the Self-Service Password Reset (SSPR) portal. 2. Verify identity via registered mobile or email. 3. Set a new password (min 12 chars, 1 special char). 4. Wait 5 minutes for synchronization before logging in again.
